thesis.description: The problems encountered in the use of a rotating arm for the generation of wind to test microphone windscreens are presented. Tests on various windscreens of cylindrical and spherical shape, composed of single and multiple sections, indicate that the most effective windscreens are those constructed of several layers of separated sheer nylon cloth. The supporting framework for the cloth as well as the cloth itself, have a marked effect on both the reduction of wind noise and on the attenuation of the desired sound.
thesis.creator: Bredahl, Arve.
thesis.subject: Electrical Engineering.
thesis.title: Designing and testing of microphone windscreens.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Significant chemical work on the hormones of the adrenal cortex dates from 1930 when Swingle and Pfiffner (l) and Hartman and Brownell (2) prepared the first extracts of cortical tissue which would maintain life in the adrenalectomised animal. In 1934 groups of chemists associated with Kendall and Mason, Wintersteiner and Pfiffner, and Reichstein, began investigations aimed at the isolation and characterization of the cortical hormones. Within a few years twenty-eight crystalline steroids were isolated and all groups of steroid hormones, namely, cortical, progestational, androgenic and estrogenic, were represented (3).
thesis.creator: Bligh, Emerson. G.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Biogenesis of adrenal cortical steroids.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The problem of generating long cylindrical electron beams of almost constant diameter has received much attention in recent years. Space charge spreading due to the repulsion of the like charges in the beam must be eliminated by an external focusing field. Sets of widely spaced electrostatic or magnetostatic lenses (15) have been used where charge densities were low, while uniform longitudinal magnetic fields (2, 15) have been used where charge densities were high. J.R. Pierce (5), in a Letter to the Editor of the Journal of Applied Physics, September 1953, suggested that spatially alternating magnetic fields could be used to advantage in place of the uniform magnetic fields.
thesis.creator: Blevis, Earl. H.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: The focusing of cylindrical electron beams with periodic magnetic fields.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Amphibians and reptiles comprise an important major segment of the vertebrate fauna of Canada: major in the sense of numbers of individuals; and important in the sense of economic value. The numbers of insects, other invertebrates, small vertebrates and especially rodents that these animals consume during a summer season are astronomical and attests to their economic value to Canadian agriculture and forestry.
thesis.creator: Bleakney, John. S.
thesis.subject: Zoology.
thesis.title: A zoogeographical study of the amphibians and reptiles of eastern Canada.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This study of the mysids of the Great Bras d' Or of Cape Breton Island is part of an investigation into the bionomics of the cod worm, Porrocaecum decipiens (Krabbe), conducted by the Fisheries Research Board of Canada in Cape Breton and elsewhere. This worm occurs as a larval form in several fishes and as an adult in seals (Scott, D. M., 1953, 1954). The investigation in Cape Breton was initiated by Dr. D. M. Scott in 1949 and continued until 1951 when the author took over the study in that area.
thesis.creator: Black, William. F.
thesis.subject: Zoology.
thesis.title: The Mysidacea of the Bras d’Or lakes.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis bas for its subject the Anglo-French Military and Naval Staff Conversations. These "Conversations" consisted of direct verbal and written communications between the British and French War Offices and Admiralties, for the purpose of elaborating joint plans for possible armed co-operation both on land and on the seas, against an eventual German aggression. These Anglo-French Staff Conversations began in January, 1906, and continued right up to July, 1914. They were conducted under a veil of secrecy, and were formally revealed to the public only one day before Britain went to war.
thesis.creator: Bider, Milton. A.
thesis.subject: History.
thesis.title: The Anglo-French military and naval staff conversations, 1906-1914.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The excitation function for the production of F18 from F19 under proton bombardment at energies 10-90 Mev has been determined. Carbon in the teflon (CF2) targets served as monitor. The excitation function rises sharply from the 9.1 Mev threshold and reaches a maximum of 85 millibarns at 24 Mev; then gradually drops to a nearly steady value of 50 millibarns at the upper energy limit.
thesis.creator: Bernstein, Hyman.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: F19(p,pn)F18 excitation function.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The process of combustion may be regarded as an exothermic chemical reaction which tends to accelerate and is accompanied by flame. The rate at which it proceeds depends on several factors, the most significant probably being the temperature, for a combustible mixture will not usually burn unless the temperature is raised to a critical value (other factors constant). Closely associated with “spontaneous ignition temperature”, as it is called, is the phenomenon of ignition delay, which represents the time interval between the attainment of conditions suitable for combustion and the onset of ignition.
thesis.creator: Bernard, Ernest. A.
thesis.subject: Mechanical Engineering.
thesis.title: Spontaneous ignition delays of propane injected into a hot air stream.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: High polymers, such as cellulose, are polymolecular, i.e., their component molecules exhibit a usually widely varying molecular weight. Being non-uniform, they are infinitely variable and the molecular weight distribution may vary from sample to sample of one and the same high polymer. Although of the same average molecular weight and chemical constitution, two polymeric specimens might accordingly show quite different properties depending on their particular molecular weight distribution, which will affect its behavior both in the solid and the dissolved state.
thesis.creator: Bennett, Clifton. F.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The effect of degree of substitution on the fractional precipitation of cellulose nitrates.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The complete record of the first two years of radiosonde observations from the Polar Basin have been analyzed with respect to thermal inversions. An objective classification system was introduced to permit exact determinations of type, magnitudes of component layers, and frequencies of occurrence, of inversions. The method has general applicability to other portions of the radiosonde ascent. A new unit of inversion intensity was introduced and appears to be an improvement over the use of lapse rate.
thesis.creator: Belmont, Arthur. D.
thesis.subject: Geography.
thesis.title: Lower tropospheric inversions at Ice Island T-3.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The problem indicated in the preceding quotation bas accompanied the process of economic development throughout the Western world. The specialization of labour and the large-scale use of capital have not only led to a manifold increase in labour productivity, but they have also raised the problem of maintaining price stability and avoiding severe depressions and inflations. In contrast, the economics of underdeveloped countries are characterized by stability. We may say, therefore, that economic equilibrium and stability are not synonymous with prosperity. On the contrary, economic expansion is a pre-requisite for a high and increasing level of living.
thesis.creator: Baumgartner, Helmut. W.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Economics.
thesis.title: Problems of resource allocation in Quebec agriculture.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Since the up-take of gases and vapours by solids having a high surface to mass ratio was first described by Scheele (1) in 1773 two main methods of investigation have been employed. First, the way in which the amount of gas or vapour taken up varies with pressure and temperature may be determined. The resulting data are usually expressed by means of sorption isotherms. Second, the heat given out in the sorption process can be measured either by direct calorimetry or indirectly determined from the variation of pressure with temperature for constant amount sorbed.
thesis.creator: Barton, Stuart. S.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Heats of sorption and adsorption process by isothermal calorimetry.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The term gastro-enteritis is applied to a set of clinical signs and symptoms, namely: diarrhea, vomiting, and usually some degree of elevated temperature. Other symptoms, such as nausea, cramps, headache and anorexia may or may not be present. Synonyms for the term gastro-enteritis that have been commonly used are: dyspepsia, summer diarrhea, enteritis, cholera infantum, epidemic diarrhea of infants, and infantile diarrhea and vomiting.
thesis.creator: Barnes, Marion. J.
thesis.subject: Bacteriology.
thesis.title: Serological and physiological studies on Escherichia coli from cases of gastroenteritis in infants.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Throughout the ages the various types of architecture or mans way of materially expressing the thoughts, and the ways of living of his age, have been curtailed by the available materials and inherited techniques. Wood was one of the first universal building materials. It was readily attacked by the elements and the buildings as well as the culture of the times was soon lost to history. With the advent of stone a permanent building material was available to the builders and sculptures of the day.
thesis.creator: Banks, Ronald. H.
thesis.subject: Civil Engineering and Applied Mechanics.
thesis.title: Flexural stresses and deflections of a prestressed concrete I-beam.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis is concerned with an exploratory analysis of case aide practices in five hospital social service departments. Administrative personnel have become increasingly alert to the possibility of separating the more routine duties, which have been traditionally part of the function of a social service department from those services that are professional in order to pass them on to personnel suitably trained at a non-professional or technician level.
thesis.creator: Banffy, Ruth.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: The use of case aides in medical school service.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A flow apparatus was used to investigate the effect of certain parameters like fuel air ratio, oxygen concentration and air preheat temperature on the ignition delay of propane injected into a hot air stream. All investigations were restricted to the low range of fuel air ratios (max. - 0.025) and it was found that (a) ignition delay increased with the increase of fuel air ratio up to a transition point and thereafter remained constant until the flame flashed back to a point near the fuel nozzle or disappeared from the flame tube depending on the air mass flow and preheat temperature.
thesis.creator: Balakrishna, Narasipur. H.
thesis.subject: Mechanical Engineering.
thesis.title: Some aspects of the spontaneous ignition delay of propane injected into a hot air stream.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: β,β-dimethylacrylic acid (I, β-methylcrotonic acid, DMA) has been prepared by a variety of methods, none of which give a good yield. Several routes involve α-halo-isovaleric acid derivatives as intermediates, from which the unsaturated acid is obtained by elimination of the halogen atom together with one of the β-hydrogen atoms (1, 2, 3).
thesis.creator: Aprile, Marie. A.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Synthesis and metabolism of C14-dimethylacrylic acid.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Eugène Dabit (1898-1936), peintre et écrivain de l'entre-deux-guerres, consacra ses énergies et son talent à mieux faire connaitre le peuple dont il était né. Elève de Roger Martin du Gard, ami et protégé d'André Gide, i l mourut subitement en Russie avant d'avoir pu donner toute sa mesure. Faussement étiqueté "populiste", Dabit dépasse ses contemporains des années 1930-1936 par le témoignage objectif et frémissant de son œuvre romanesque, Il a subi, depuis vingt ans, un injuste oubli que notre travail a l'ambition de réparer.
thesis.creator: Andrews, Oliver.
thesis.subject: French.
thesis.title: Eugéne Dabit, sa vie et son œuvre.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The Woodstook and Millville areas are in the continuation of the New England Province of the Northern Appalachians. The oldest exposed rocks are sedimentary and are presumed to be Ordovician in age. Overlying these are Silurian sediments, which contain the iron and manganese deposits of the Woodstook area. The Ordovician and Silurian sediments indicate deposition in an unstable marine geosynclinal environment. Granite and allied rocks intruded the Silurian and older strata during the Devonian period.
thesis.creator: Anderson, Francis. D.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: The geology of the Woodstock and Millville areas, New Brunswick.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Muhammad 'Ali was born in 1878 at Rampur, scion of "a fairly prosperous and cultured Indian Muslim family”, whose members had served in the civil and military administration of Rampur State since before the Mutiny. Young ‘Ali's primary education followed the custom of his class. Under a pedagogue he read a few Persian classics, learned to read -- without understanding the Qur’an in Arabic, and absorbed the routine of the religious rituals practised in his Sunni home.
thesis.creator: Watson, William. J.
thesis.subject: Islamic Studies.
thesis.title: Muhammad ‘Ali and the Khilafat movement.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: He lay in his bedroom in the dark and the tick of the grandfather clock on the landing came to him as he lay, the slow and rusty tick that he had always woken to, always gone to sleep by, always been alone with when the night began and when it ended. From where he lay on his cot he could see the clock through the open door. As it was only four o'clock in the afternoon, neither the beginning nor the end of night, the sailing ship which followed round the hours on its own turning disc had not yet poked its bow-sprit up; it rode quite over-turned above the numeral six, nor would it begin to right itself again until the hour came round to six.
thesis.creator: Waterhouse, John.
thesis.subject: English.
thesis.title: The metronome: a novel.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Discussions of the problem of time estimation often lead to unnecessary disagreements and confusion because of certain vagueness and ambiguity in the usage of terms. It is imperative, therefore, to clarify the terminology at the outset. In experiments on time estimation, the subject (S) is required to make judgments about temporal durations. The duration that S is asked to judge is called the standard. The estimate of the standard made by S is called the judgment.
thesis.creator: Waksberg, Helene.
thesis.subject: Psychology.
thesis.title: Serial-position gradient in time estimation.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Ever since civilization exist, the notion of exchange and of transporting has been one of the outstanding elements of life in human society. One may say that the development of civilization and the evolution of all its main attributes (economic, political, cultural, and social) rest upon man-made means of communication. Among the many factors which have conditioned and at the same time shaped the history of mankind, transportation and communication have been not causes, but certainly essential elements of the progressive development of society.
thesis.creator: Vlasic, Ivan.
thesis.subject: International Air Law.
thesis.title: The grant of passage and exercise of commercial rights in international air transport.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The term “Vapour Snake” was first associated with a rather unusual phenomenon by Phibbs and Schiff (1). This phenomenon was reported to occur upon the immersion of an ampule of pure degassed cyclohexane in a dry ice-acetone freezing mixture. A solid crust first formed on the surface of the liquid, while a thin sheath of glassy solid appeared below the liquid level next to the walls of the ampule - the rest of the cyclohexane remaining liquid.
thesis.creator: Verschingel, Roger. H.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: I. Investigation of the ‘vapour snake’ phenomenon. II. A comparison of the production of active nitrogen by the electrodeless and condensed discharges and its reactions with oxygen containing compounds.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Before taking up the subject proper of this thesis. "An economic study of the Schuman plan", we would first like to introduce the reader to the Schuman plan itself. When we refer to an economic plan, we generally have in mind a program of action aiming at certain modifications of the economy for a given period of time. The Schuman plan is not a plan of this kind. It is a treaty, which has been signed for a duration of 50 years. It represents in fact the Constitution which will regulate the action of a new independent power "The European Community of Coal and Steel", and also provides a statement of the basic principles which are to regulate and inspire the policy of this new power.
thesis.creator: Velay, Clément. C.
thesis.subject: Economics.
thesis.title: An economic study of the Schuman Plan.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
